forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
@Rance  
First thing you should do (and also MAC's should have available dd or a similar tool) would be to make a "forensic like" image of the whole disk of the I-pod.  

Then work on the image instead of on the device.   

In any case, if you only have a MAC, you most probably have better assistance/advice on a MAC forum, here people are mostly Windows/Linux users on PC's.  

Here is a nice sum-up:  
[http://guides.macrum...gs_from_an_iPod](http://guides.macrumors.com/Recovering_Songs_from_an_iPod "External link")

forumNotes.author: JonF
forumNotes.content: On the PC [Media Widget](http://www.easyipodtransfer.com/ipod-to-itunes-transfer "External link") has performed well for me on several occasions. You can transfer a big library without buying it but it's tedious. There are others out ther in the $15-$40 price range, but I haven't tried them. I bet there are such things for the Mac.
